# Task

You are given a DataFrame `df_cars` with car data with columns `manufacturer` and `model`. Write a function audi_filter that filters down the dataset to only the rows with manufacturer “audi” and model being “a4 or “a4 quattro”, then it should create a new column `audi_a4_type` that equals `true` across all rows. Then return the resulting DataFrame.



# Data

df_cars = DataFrame(manufacturer=["audi", "audi", "bmw", "audi", "audi", "ford", "audi", "audi", "toyota", "audi"],
    model=["a4", "a6", "3 series", "a4 quattro", "q7", "fusion", "tt", "a4", "corolla", "a4 quattro"])
audi_filter(df_cars)

# Function Definition
```julia
function audi_filter(df::DataFrame)
    # Filter the DataFrame to only include Audi A4 and A4 Quattro models
    df_filtered = filter(row -> row.manufacturer == "audi" && (row.model == "a4" || row.model == "a4 quattro"), df)
    
    # Create a new column with boolean values indicating whether it's an A4 or A4 Quattro
    df_filtered = transform(df_filtered, :audi_a4_type => ByRow(x -> true) => "audi_a4_type")
    
    return df_filtered
end
```

# Function Application
```julia
using DataFrames

# Sample DataFrame provided in the task
df_cars = DataFrame(manufacturer=["audi", "audi", "bmw", "audi", "audi", "ford", "audi", "audi", "toyota", "audi"],
    model=["a4", "a6", "3 series", "a4 quattro", "q7", "fusion", "tt", "a4", "corolla", "a4 quattro"])

# Apply the audi_filter function to the sample DataFrame
result = audi_filter(df_cars)
```

The `audi_filter` function first filters the `df_cars` DataFrame to only include rows where the manufacturer is "audi" and the model is either "a4" or "a4 quattro". Then it creates a new column called `audi_a4_type` with boolean values that are all set to `true`.

The function application demonstrates how to use the `audi_filter` function with the provided sample DataFrame. The resulting DataFrame, `result`, will contain only the rows from Audi A4 and A4 Quattro models, along with the new column `audi_a4_type` set to `true` for all rows.
